hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: The friendly staff who go above all standard expectations are what really sets the Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort apart from any of the 4 other hotels I have stayed at in Waikiki. The upgraded, modern and spacious rooms are as quiet as you hope for. I will never stay anywhere else if I can help it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Stayed 12 days for business. Very clean hotel with limited bar and restaurant on site. We used valet service multiple times everyday and everyone was pleasant and very helpful. Great recommendations for nearby resturants and how to get to the beach.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: I spent a week here on business, very nice Hotel, shops at the lower level.Room was nice and faced the ocean.The staff here is exceptionally friendly and helpful.The Regency Club is nice, plenty of food.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Would recommend this hotel to anyone but especially to family and friends. I did want more choices for food in hotel but there was alot of other places to eat that were close by. Would go to this hotel on any further visits .

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Best part of the beach, for sure, high views which change everything, great food in regency club free. Surfs up every day and every night!! So much fun and walk every where. Drove around Oahu for sure! Great time

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: outstanding place to stay and worth the money. I will surely invite other family friends and relatives to stay in this place anytime they will visit Honolulu. If ever have a chance again to go back to Hawaii I definitely stay again in this place.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: We loved this hotel and stayed for a mini honeymoon! Really my only complaint is that the food is very expensive and it’s only okay. We wouldn’t recommend getting the calamari at the pool, it was very fishy and we couldn’t finish eating it. However, with that being said it is an amazing hotel, definitely on the pricier side but you get what you pay for.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Everything is easy at Hyatt, the check in, the check out, marvellous location, just in front of Waikiki Beach, the rooms are good, with famous TOTO to make our life easier.The swimming pool is not full of people.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: As a Hyatt status member, Nicole and Stacey (VIP Services) made me feel very welcomed, amazing first impression! Additionally, had dinner at The Buffet and the service from the staff and my waitress Pam was exceptional. Their recommendations were on-point, and Pam didn’t overly check-on me to disturb my peaceful eating. Awesome Hyatt experience at this location! Thank you!

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: We stayed here for two nights. The check-in process was rather long but the rooms were large, clean und comfortable. The view over Waikiki Beach is amazing. The location is good and one can walk everywhere.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: We couldn't have chosen a better location,our room was directly facing the beach which was truly magnificent. The room was very clean and spacious but the furniture needed an update. All of the staff that we encountered from the front desk to the housekeeping staff and any store clerks within the complex were very friendly and helpful. Our only complaint was that the selection of restaurants were very few. We ate at other restaurants our whole stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Excellent hotel. Stacey made our 47th Anniversary very special. This is a beautiful place with great people. We have been here many time but this stay was over the top. The room was oceanfront and the weather was perfect.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: The Hyatt Regency can always be counted on to deliver the highest quality and professional service. I have always recommended the Hyatt for the last 25 years and will continue to do so in the future. The Hyatt Regency on Waikiki Beach is fantastic, I highly recommend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: This location was amazing. Beautiful views, great service and very friendly staff! They took great care of me. They ensured I had what I needed and when I had specific requests they gladly assisted. I was traveling solo and I felt so safe and comfortable.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: The reservation receptionist is very very sneaky. I told her I wanted to book a Room at the Hyatt Regency in Waikiki so she pulled a sneaky on me and made the reservation for Maui. How could someone be so stupid and not realize maui is a different island then Oahu? Reservation receptionist is very stupid or possibly high on drugs. Almost everyone knows Maui is a different island than Waikiki beach. It was a great inconvenience to have to call back to talk to another reservation clerk to get it straightened out. The 2nd reservation clerk was a very heavy breather and kind of rude.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: My husband and I stayed at the Hyatt Regency Waikiki Resort and Spa for 6 days/5 nights in February 2020-March 2020. This is a great hotel with a few caveats. We booked a King Bed with Waikiki View + Club Access (paid for via points + World of Hyatt Club Upgrade award- during our stay it would have been about $260/night including their $42/night resort fee and taxesfor just the room I think it was closer to $350/night to include the club upgrade)We were contacted a few days prior to our arrival by the VIP manager Stacey Martin to confirm our arrival details and if there was anything we needed (not sure if this was because I am an World of Hyatt Explorist or because of the Club access addition). Stacey warmly greeted us at check in which was a breeze and we got lovely flower leis (the true tourist Hawaiian experience!) and there was sweet pineapple tea at check-in! We arrived a bit prior to our check-in time and were able to be accommodated into our room early. We were assigned room 2860. The room was lovely with a nice view of Waikiki. The hotel surprised us with a cute heart shaped orchids on our bed and towel birds and a gift box of chocolate as this trip was for our babymoon! Very sweet!Unfortunately, the room we were in had a bad seal on the balcony doors and there was very extreme wooshing sounds leaking into the room at night that disturbed my sleep - if we pushed the door closed (but not locked because it would leave a gap) the sound would stop but eventually the seal would loosen again). We contacted Stacey about early the next morning and it Jason the manager from Housekeeping came by to try to remedy the problem (very nice guy!). Unfortunately, their quick fix was not quite enough for me. Stacey very expertly moved us to a different room on a lower floor (room 960 -two queens but a very nice ocean front view) hoping it would have less of a wind noise problem. We didn't have any more issues for the rest of our lovely stay! I would definitely come back to this hotel but only if I could guarantee a lower floor (I booked my room with points so we had less of a room selection, but we don't have a problem paying the regular pricing for what you get at this hotel). We had to call the front desk for information and when you call front desk the first option to to request a room change....which is telling that it is a known issue... Usually, when my husband and I travel we look for places to take our extended family in the future as we often invite along/pay and arrange for both sets of our parents and sometimes siblings and spouses so this place is definitely in consideration for a block of rooms in the future. The Hyatt Regency Waikiki is so close to the beach (across the street!-literally a 4 lane street in front of the hotel), and close to both regular and high end shopping and a plethora of restaurants! Their resort fee (which we didn't pay as we paid with points this time) is currently $42/night but it includes water bottles, tote bags, discount on car rentals, discount on surf classes, credit toward bike rentals, classes (yoga, cooking, cocktail, etc), beach towels and beach chairs you can bring with you to the beach or anywhere!!! Well worth it for the ease and convenience it gives you. The Club lounge is nice for a light breakfast, evening snacks and very affordable beer and wine (noon to 3 or so is slim pickings as its only non-alcoholic drinks, cookies, and snack bars). The pigeons and other birds outside are somewhat aggressive if you are on the patio but the patio seating is quite nice.Additionally, there is a Hertz Car Rental in the building with very affordable rates (with corporate discount at least) so renting car for a day was very easy!My husband and I would definitely stay here again as the location, service, amenities and rooms are great!

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: this was so nice a place to stay 1) facing Waikiki beach 2) local market place happenings Tues & Thur evenings 3) Friday night local song/dance programs 4) amenities in house accessible 5) Kai coffee shop has the best sandwiches & Coffee of course 6) helpful and friendly staff

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Had a great stay at the Hyatt. It’s location is in the center of Waikiki and the iconic beach front is right across the street. Hotel is well staffed and very friendly. I was always greeted with a smile. The front staff always had good ideas and locations of places to visit. It’s a little pricey but well worth it. Aloha is a real thing and you feel it at the Hyatt Regency.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: I love Hawaii it is great and the Hyatt is great close to the beach friendly helpful staff great restaurants in the hotel great position straight opposite the beach and close to the shops and buses

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: One of our favorite stops when travelling, the hotel is in a great location with super friendly staff. Not like other resort hotels that always appear super busy and crowded, whilst it was busy you always felt comfortable, yet treated like a real person and not just a number

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: The hotel staff was very welcoming and helpful right from the get go. The rooms were wonderful and the beds were very comfortable (especially after the air travel and daily excursions during our stay). The bathrooms were also very clean with all the amenities. It was a thoroughly enjoyable stay at the hotel overlooking the ocean.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Had our honeymoon here. The room was clean, great view, great service, we got a free bottle of champagne and on our first day we arrived to our room that had flowers on the bed and a box of chocolates. What a great place to stay in a great part of town. Only hiccup was the AC wasn’t working and maintenance had to show up 3 times to fix it but it eventually worked, was just kinda hot and stuffy in the room at times

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Attending a seminar here and stayed 4 days. The carpet in our room needed replacing, old and worn but the room overall was nice and we had a view of Diamond Head and partial view of the beach. Service was great and everyone was very friendly.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Great time had by all. Highly recommend. Location fantastic. My grandchildren were amazed with the activities and stores in the hotel - farmers market and all. We would definitely stay here again. Aloha for now.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: As you can imagine, this hotel’s location on Waikiki is popular. It is central to everything and you can walk to great restaurants, shopping and hop across the street to one of the world’s most popular beaches. It’s a must visit just for the location.The customer service at this hotel is what you expect from the Hyatt brand. Everyone is accommodating and goes above what is expected. My family loved the location and the staff made us feel like Ohana (family). I truly appreciated everything and all the efforts by the team. It’s a little loud during the day but the night is much quieter so sleeping can have challenges for some but it’s worth it because of the views. If you go to Honolulu or Hawaii for the first time, stay here for the convenience to everything.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: My favorite hotel in all my travels. Perfectly central location to beach, restaurants, shopping. Great ambiance to the hotel grounds as well as the room itself. Clean, easy to navigate the hotel grounds, responsive service.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Hotel was located in the heart of Waikiki so no need for a car. The hotel room was clean and beds were very comfortable. The food at all the restaurants was very good and the buffet had great choices. Located across the street from the Duke Paoa Kahanamoku Statue. Hotel staff was very friendly, helpful and accommodating. Plenty of shops within the hotel property with a farmers market on certain days.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: This hotel is in the best location In Waikiki. Across the road from Waikiki beach and close to the iconic Duke’s, Cheesecake Factory and Moana Surfrider. It’s an extremely relaxing location and hotel with ease of access to everything you would need for a relaxing holiday. The thing that made this hotel stand out for us was the genuinely welcoming, caring staff who strive o ensure you feel at home and experience great food and service. We experienced a warm personal welcome by name every morning at breakfast. We went to the seafood buffet for dinner to celebrate my husband’s birthday- our lovely waitress happily cracked open crab shell and gave us a lesson in how to extract the meat, all without request. Great service! We loved the hotel’s green initiatives such as the refillable waterbottle for guest. Thanks again for the outstanding experience and we look forward to seeing you again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Booked this hotel last minute due to dissatisfaction with a nearby hotel I had reservations with. The Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa was an excellent selection and will be my go to location for all future stays at this location, of which I visit twice a year for my consulting business,
user_name:
sgconsulting01
North Cape May, New Jersey

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: We stayed at the Hyatt for the first time because we had a wedding for a Saturday night. We checked in on a Friday for a ocean view room with a king bed. When we got to our room we found it had 2 queen beds and a partial ocean view with 2/3 over looking a construction site. We called the front desk to let them know we had booked a king bed room and we would like to get a king bed because we have a toddler who sleeps between my husband and I. They told us they do not have any rooms with a king bed available but we could move to a different room the next day depending on what time the other guest check out. I told them if we had booked a room with a king bed they should have that room...right? Anyways we declined the move because the wedding was the next day and it would be to hectic to move with a toddler and having to rush. As we looked around our room, we found our TV did not work and our mini fridge. We called the front desk again and someone came to fix the TV. Our mini fridge wouldn’t work so someone brought another fridge to our room which took up a lot of space. Unfortunately our stay at the Hyatt wasn’t a good one and as of right now we will take our business elsewhere

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: The mantenience of the hotel is very good.The costumer service from all levels is fantastic.The location is amazing.The food is yummy.The private and public areas are impeccable clean.This is the perfect venue for honeymoon; business or vacation.The Regency club is very convenient the food and schedulle is generous.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Check in was fast and easy. Room was easy to find. Beautiful views. Clean rooms. Close to everything in waikiki. A lot of shopping and meal options in walking distance. Valet was fast and convenient! Overall awesome experience

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Accommodating and Exclusive Resort. I would recommend The Hyatt Regency Waikiki to Family and Friends. There are ample stores within the hotel to accommodate all of your needs and the hotel is beautiful.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: First, avoid the Blue Ohana shop like the plague! They are dishonest. The male clerk told me he gave me a 12% discount for a final price of $65 on a shirt that sells for $35 on the internet. Worse yet, the receipt (when I read it later) says "all sales are final." Sure enough, they don't take returns. Shame on Hyatt for letting these crooks occupy space in their hotel. Aside from this shop, this is a fine hotel, and the service is excellent and is extremely friendly. The Lounge has a very good view and friendly staff. I would have provided five stars, but the experience with the shop left a bitter taste in my mouth.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Our family just have 4 days at Hyatt. Very good service and amazing fast services. Only one concern, front desk service a little slow, or maybe more more staff is better. However, our next vacation , we will stay at Hyatt again.Thanks for all staff at Hyatt.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: We were celebrating our 40th anniversary & were pleasantly surprised by Lei greetings not to mention chocolates and flower decorations and a nice card with invitation for bottle of champagne. Room was lovely although had some rambunctious children next door but were quieted once alerted.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Beautiful place, beautiful view. The room was great, the view spectacular at sunset. The hotel employees were great. They were so helpful and pleasant to deal with, it was a great experience. Highly recommend this hotel. walking distance to many shops, restaurants and the beach is across the street and a great pool overlooking the beach.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Family with 2 young kids. Had a great time located right across from the beach with ocean view room. Service was excellent. Very convenient with restaurants and shops all located within the hotel and easy stroll along the strip.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Upon arrival we were greeted with a smile and a big friendly Aloha greeting!! That makes your stay so much better right from the very start. Because we are Hyatt and Mlife Rewards members, we were upgraded to an oceanfront room. All I can say is wow!! The view is amazing! The room was clean, quiet, and more than what we expected. The Hyatt went out of it's way for us. We had access to the club lounge were we had appetizers and a drink in the late afternoon and then breakfast in the morning. Thank you Hyatt!! We will definitely look into staying at this resort again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Went there for new years with my wife for a week. I have booked Moana Surfrider actoss the street for first 3 days of our trip because we weren’t sure if we wanted to island hop or stay for the remaining days there. Moana is the worst decision ever. I was glad we only booked 3 days there and walked across the street to this hotel. Price is better, rooms are newer, and a great service. I would highly recommend this place for their cleanliness, service, and value. Location was fantastic as well

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Always a Great Choice. Nice Hotel right in the heart of Waikiki! Clean and Friendly Staff. Great Ocean View. Walk across Street to Main Beachfront. Lots of Stores and Restaurants close by. We really enjoyed our stay with no regrets!

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Hotel room overlooking Waikiki Beach with gorgeous view. Perfect location for beach access, walking around Honolulu. Staff lovely. Good food at pool restaurant, fruit plate was excellent. Easy access to shops in complex - especially Paradise Island!

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: We had an exceptional stay at the Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort and Spa! Our needs were met (and exceeded) every step of the way. The service was fantastic and the resort is in a great location—steps from the beach! We also got massages at the spa and those were fantastic as well. We hope to return soon!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: We stayed at the corner room located in the Ewa tower 19FL for 3 nights. The view from the room was amazing.. we could see the Waikiki beach and the city buildings together. The room was well cleaned and spacious enough to open all our luggage on the floor. The furnitures was well maintained. We enjoyed dinner buffet on the 3rd floor.. the outdoor tables were perfect to enjoy the sunset from Waikiki beach. The food was very nice, especially fresh oysters, scallops and king crabs were very delicious. The hotel location is right middle of the Waikiki so it was so convenient to walk around to all the shops and restaurants.What I liked the most was the hotel cares the environment. They placed reusable water bottles and a bag in the room. We refilled the water from the hotel and carried them.. very useful! We will definitely choose this hotel again for our next visit.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Overcrowded - noisy. Long lines at reception desk. No room service other than ordering from outside vendors. Limited restaurants (mainly poolside) in hotel so have to leave hotel to eat. Walls are thin so they provide earplugs with room and directions on how to use white noise on your phone. Older rooms. Small. View is lovely. Location at the end of Waikiki which is good.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: This is an awful hotel in a good location. If you are considering a stay at this hotel, I urge you to seriously reconsider.We last stayed here in 2012 and everything in my review (https://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g60982-d242435-r147757917-Hyatt_Regency_Waikiki_Beach_Resort_Spa-Honolulu_Oahu_Hawaii.html) still applies. We have stayed in several other Waikiki hotels since 2012 and we thought we’d give this place another chance since Hyatt claims it has been “refreshed.” That was an unfortunate mistake. This hotel was built in the early 1980’s and has only had largely ineffective updates since then. The walls of the rooms are sloppily painted (over wallpaper) and the door frames and baseboards are chipped and dirty. The interior and exterior doors and windows are obviously original and provide little in the way of soundproofing. Other guests in the hallway sound like they are in the room with you, and noise from the street enters the room unabated through the patio doors. The rooms are just as sparse and tired as they were in 2012. In our room there was sofa chair that looked OK but when we sat on it, we realized it’s just a thin foam cushion on a plywood platform. It’s quite uncomfortable.The tiny bathroom with the shower in an old, stained bathtub screams “motel” not refined hotel. This place really is a dump. With room rates at $300 and up and a daily resort fee of $45 (plus tax) it’s a total rip off.We were told on two separate occasions by members of the hotel staff that it was acquired recently and is losing money because “the new owners overpaid.” I wouldn’t expect a drastic renovation in the near future.Now, let me tell you about the overall Waikiki environment. Since our last visit in January 2019 Honolulu has decided that street performers can use amplification equipment all day and evening (up to 10 pm, but in our experience it’s closer to 11 pm when it stops). Now, you might not see this as much of an issue until you find out these amplifiers are more suitable for stadium performances than street performances. They are VERY loud. In our 20th floor room they drowned out conversation on the lanai, and inside the room they were loud enough to to require turning the TV volume way up to hear it. This went on all day (starting by 10 am) and into the evening (past 10 pm).We used my iPhone sound meter (tested against professional sound meters as very accurate) and found the noise at street level at 87dB, which is 7dB beyond the threshold for danger to hearing.There are only a few street performers generating this noise. It is incredible that such a small group of people could generate so much intrusive noise disturbing thousands of tourists staying in hotels nearby, including this one.I find it strange that the hotel association here would not approach the city and ask for action on this. We were told by the hotel there is a bylaw applicable to Waikiki that specifically allows amplifiers for street performers, apparently without regard to how loud they are. It’s as if the city is deliberately spiting the tourists on which it largely depends for its economy.Within the hotel, there is a fountain in the atrium between the two towers that generates 77dB of noise. The front desk staff agreed it is very loud and they don’t like it either. It makes communicating with the guests difficult, but for some reason the powers that be must think it creates a Hawai’I ambiance. News flash: it doesn’t, it’s just very loud white noise. The whole atmosphere in the hotel common areas is unpleasant and seems to urge you to leave as soon as possible.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: This hotel was clean. The rooms were nice. It’s very large and a lot of shops to walk around at. The staff are very nice. I would recommend it. The only thing I found was there was very little entertainment at the hotel as in shows.... but overall we were happy with our stay. The beach is right infront which is lovely

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: We were allocated a room in the Ewa wing. It is directly opposite the daily and nightly buskers with loud sound systems that play until 10-11pm at night. Extremely loud and noisy. Ask for a room in the Diamond Head wing. The rooms are generally clean and well stocked but the furniture is very old and some of it broken. The room we stayed in had lights that didn’t work and closet doors that were skew and wouldn’t close. Room very clean.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Of all our stays in Honolulu, this was by far our favorite hotel. Location is perfect-directly across street from Waikiki Beach. The hotel provides you beach towels and Tommy Bahama beach chairs to take to the beach. The hotel pool is lovely with great ocean views. The hotel has a cool amenity of texting questions and getting immediate answers. We texted to have our room made up...the texted back and sent house immediately. We texted for surfing lessons recommendations and they text back with a location across street that provides hotel guests a discount.The hotel provides water bottles in your room that you can refill at water stations on every floor of the hotel. So convenient!!We will definitely stay again. Picture attached is sunset from our balcony.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Excellent location. Beach across the street and convenient. Fabulous views from 3rd floor patio. Club room offers an excellent variety and value. Thoroughly enjoyed my stay there. Would recommend for business or pleasure.Plan to stay to there again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Stayed with my boys. Staff was amazing and even got a small fridge delivered to my room to keep my drinks extra cold. Got chairs and towels to go to the beach making it very convenient. Best hotel experience I’ve had so far !

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: the hotel was nice but i would probably have eaten out for breakfast for what we paid - there wasnt a great variety on a daily- the staff was friendly and the location was perfect for those that like the city life- not too beachy

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: My family and I enjoyed our time here. We had an oceanfront room and loved watching the surfers and paddle boarders from our room. The rooms were clean and the staff was pleasant. The location is perfect as you can walk to shops and restaurants. My only complaint is the bathroom/shower area was very small. I would have preferred a walk-in shower vs. a tub/shower combo. The tub height was high and was difficult to get in and out. I would definitely stay here again and ask for a handicap room for the shower. The pool was small, but we enjoyed the pool bar/restaurant. The food and drinks were very good.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Hotel very closed to shopping stores ,lots of restaurants to dine in however surroundings too noisy , not a very relaxing hotel to stay. Friendliness of the hotel staff is poor to average. Ocean view is actually partial city view and ocean view. Elevators too slow.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: For a huge hotel right on Waikiki, one would expect compromises to cleaning, service, and quality from just the sheer traffic. Not so at the Hyatt Regency Waikiki. It was a great blend of location and ambiance.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: The Hyatt was a great place for our 4 day 5 night honeymoon! We had an oceanfront room and it was worth it. Beautiful views of Waikiki and the ocean. Centrally located for shopping and food. Hertz rental in the resort made daily car rentals a breeze! Room was well cleaned when we asked for room service. Was actually pretty quiet most evenings and mornings. Would certainly stay here again if we have the chance to make it back to Oahu.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Excellent experiences were brought by the hotel that is situated at the center in waikiki! Especially ocean view from the room window was very magnificent.It was one of the most impressiveexperiences to watch a beautiful sunset.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Awesome all around. Room was clean, staff was great and very helpful. Highly recommend this to anyone visiting. Area is great location and hotel club lounge has great food, drinks, snacks, etc. wonderful vacation

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: The hotel was nice and is literally across the street from the beach. The rooms were clean but the pillows on the bed were very flat and uncomfortable. I was switched around a few times for our room having a foul odor from the toilet and sink every time it was used. All the staff in the hotel were very friendly and professional except for a few at the front desk. The pool has a great view and was a chill spot to have drinks or food during the day. I would stay here again and hopefully with all the construction they have going on it will be a much better experience next time.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: We stayed here for a week on business. I really felt that staff was super attentive and did a good job supplying the best quality meals I've ever experienced on a business trip. Staff here he seems happy which speaks loads about the management team. I think the Hyatt generally is very well managed and the food and drink is excellent.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: If you are traveling to Waikiki Beach, stay at the Hyatt Regency hotel. Very friendly staff, clean and centrally located. The higher level rooms with beach access give you a great view for your stay. Watch the surfers, boats and gorgeous sunsets. We'll stay here again for sure!

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: We have been returning to this wonderful property for over 30 years. They have always exceeded my expectations, especially being sensitive to the needs of my wife. Great Regency Club. Fun marketplace. Much larger rooms. Highly recommended this property!

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Conveniently located hotel with friendly staff over the road from Waikiki Beach. Rooms large and clean. However, there were no warnings or notifications on Hyatt or Expedia websites of building works going on on our tower nor the huge digging facing our room. Both these can be heard from the beach!! Moreover, I explained that the term “Ocean View” is a new term to mislead as we are on the side of the building with an obscured view of the ocean (facing the building works). A room where I can’t see the ocean from my bed, can’t see Diamond Head, never has direct sun but bares the noise all day is a poor room. We paid extra for this room. Shame on you Hyatt!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Hyatt regency is located at one of the best location on Waikiki beach. The beach is one street across. And is very walkable to most shopping and restaurant.The room is facing right to the ocean and we saw the rainbow too!Check in guy was very friendly too. (Joe, if I remember right)It’s one of the best experiences I had on beach resort, will definitely come back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Our family stayed at the Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort and Spa in January 2020. The hotel is ideally located in the heart of Waikiki, close to shops and with easy access across the road to Waikiki Beach.Access for a person using a wheelchair is OK, a little cumbersome but not a bother once you know the route to travel.I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Location, location, location. If you want a Waikiki experience this is a wonderful place to stay. You can walk to the beach, shopping and lots of restaurants. The staff are wonderful and helpful. We will be back again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Responsive and friendly staff. Great location. Hotel dated and in need of some upgrade and repair. Our second stay there. Good food, good valet service. Lots of noise during the day from all the construction going on in the area.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Very dissatisfied overall with our stay. During check-in it was difficult to communicate over a loud waterfall. The drinks from the pool bar were really awful (syrupy). The server was kind enough to switch them out for some wine that tasted just ok. Later on when we bought our own wine, we realized the room didn’t have glasses, and the front desk sent me on a wild goose chase to go find some. There was some loud renovation that woke us in the morning multiple times. The A/C also made a weird sound at times that would wake us. The bath tub had an unpleasant looking stain. Finally, the bathroom at the lobby level was pretty gross and unbecoming of a Hyatt resort.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: The check I process was fast and the employees are friendly. But...they will charge you a $48 resort fee even if you’re not planning to use the extras. The room was out dated and had a funny odor. Shop around there are better deals out there.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: I stayed at the Hyatt Regency this past weekend. From the moment we checked in, my spouse and I were thoroughly impressed with the amenities. The accommodations were wonderful, and we were able to switch to an ocean view room! Thank you to all of the staff that helped us including at the spa. Our “staycation” was more than we could have hoped for.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: If you want a great experience in Honolulu, choose the Hyatt. Near the trolley stop, stores handy, beach across the street. Great, and I mean great view of the beach. Spend the money and get the ocean view. It was the best! Staff was outstanding. Very helpful.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Last year, we stayed in Hyatt Regency in the Waikiki area in Honolulu and we enjoyed it. We wanted to stay this year too, starting January 18, for 5 nights. Because of its popularity, when we call, we couldn't reserve a room for 5 nights, instead, we were able to reserve 3 different rooms. But when we get there, thanks to Joanna’s efforts in the check-in desk, we were given a room in the Diamond Head Tower building for 5 nights. It has a fabulous view of the Waikiki Beach and the Ocean. Thanks Joanna! The rooms are very comfortable. It’s in a central location, close to many restaurants and shopping places. We highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: We should have asked to be put on a lower floor but loved the room-just not 39th floor. Staff was great and room was very clean. We are using twice more before returning home. Loved all the ambiance and shops around us

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: We received an e-mail and a text from Alyssa Wimmer prior to our stay asking if we needed anything prior to arrival. I responded our plane was late and when we would be in and asked for an upgrade if available. The Hyatt Regency is in a great location with access to many places to eat and shop and beautiful views of the ocean. The room was spacious and clean! Alyssa met us at check-in, completed everything quickly and was able to upgrade us. She was available to answer all our questions during our stay and was a pleasure to deal with. The bed and sheets were so comfortable that I texted Alyssa where they were ordered and she found out for us. We always stay at Hyatt hotels and have never been disappointed!!

New York City, New York

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: What an excellent resort! I stayed here with a friend recently and I also stayed here in June 2012(some renovations was going on at the time). I location was great. Me and my friends were able to walk to the mall fairly quickly. We enjoyed the pool. It’s a beachfront resort and I have to say this beach was the calmest beach out of the 5 we visited. The staff was friendly and accommodating. We rented a car and I do have to say that I was expensive for parking if you actually plan to come and go from the garage. The room we shared was subpar but I didn’t pay a lot for it considering I didn’t plan on saying in the room much. All in all a good experience.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: We have been coming to this property for over 10 years. The staff make this location top notched. Overlooking Waikiki doesn't hurt either. It is located right on city and tour bus routes and shopping. There are many places to eat within walking distance.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Beach is next to the hotel and located within a mall for great shopping. The Buffett at hyatt is incredible! Great seafood! Took some great family photos from the Regency Club. I will say never leave your food unattended outside because the birds will swoop in take over and enjoy your food.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: I am an explorist and booked for 7nights for my husband’s family reunion. The room, hotel it self, restaurants(also staffs), regency club& staffs, valet, bell man were just exceptionally helpful, kind. But NOT the front desk staffs.It seemed AlWAYS under staffed, and not as professional compare to mainland’s Hyatt properties and when I asked the front desk staff, the staff also said they’re slow because they’re understaffed! WhenI checked in(11am but informed the room is not ready, which I requested several times through email and texts, but understandable) waited so long even in the Hyatt priority line. I had to come back around 3pm to recheck in and waited so long. And every staffs looked exhausted, no welcoming or nor even a word to their Hyatt members. Since I stayed a straight 7nights, my key was not working for the Elevator and room several times I had to go back to the front desk and had to wait a long line always. They’re always busy morning to night, not enough staffs!!!It seems like they care more about Japanese credit card holder members (JCB?) since they had a seperated desk and the host was always big welcomed their guests. Parking was another hassles. It is definitely the worst self parking building ever. It’s a separated building so you’d have walk outside to cross a road in order to return to a hotel. And inside of the parking building was Super narrow you’ll have to be careful to get bumped to the wall or with other car. When I checked out I told the staff the parking was insane and the lady told us it’s because it’s only one ocean front parking(what??), yeah the front desk staffs were hilarious.But I have to say other than front desk staffs and long waits, everything else was perfect. Specially I’d like to thank to Regency club staffs(evening shifts)who tried to talked to me in Korean(he said he is trying to learn for the customers) was so nice and kind and the food quality was exceptional compare to other Hyatt’s regency club. So happy I booked with it my entire stay.I also had a breakfast everyday at Shor and the two men hosts were amazing as well. Only after the first morning the host remembered my last name to assist me better, it’s a big hotel and so many customers and it was so touched!I was having a breakfasts every single day for a week and the two men were always there, worked very hard always smiling! The room was pretty big, spacious, little bit old although they did renovations still can see the wear and tear but I would choose Hyatt regency Waikiki again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: The Hyatt Regency Waikiki is right on the water. You need to cross Kalakaua at the cross walk but the beach is right there. It also means a great view of the water from your room. Because of the hotels location and height (40 stories), the views all around are great. I do not think you can find better value for your money than the Hyatt Regency Waikiki.

Annandale, VA, United States

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: The most friendly and helpful staff I have ever encountered at a hotel. We were located on the 14th floor and the condition of the amenities in the room was great. There were several sections of the wall that had been noticeably repainted which looked out of place for this class of hotel. The window/sliding door could use some additional noise reduction as we were awoken at 7am by the sound of leaf blowers. We used the regency club lounge for breakfast and found it to have a good selection of items.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Great location with amazing views, across from Waikiki beach. The hotel is undergoing renovations however that didn’t bother us. We requested a room with an ocean view and it didn’t disappoint. The only downside is though working on the elevators they were slow. Request the tower with the better elevator service. The staff aims to please with Aloha spirit!

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: I can't say enough nice things about the Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa. Registration was easy, our rooms were spacious, we loved the water bottles in the room. The breakfast was way beyond our expectations and we had just gotten off a cruise ship. The woman who registered us recommended the aquarium for the kids and she was so right. The Resort was close to the aquarium and also Diamond Head, we were able to do both on our last day. It was the perfect way to end our stay in Hawaii.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: I only stayed for two nights. As a Hyatt Globalist I was given a room overlooking the ocean. It was very nice and the bed was comfortable. Also the room is very clean and had a good size TV. I had a number of meals at the Regency Club. The food was excellent and the staff had a great attitude and really went the extra mile. For this reason I might consider coming back to the Hyatt Waikiki Beach. In fact the staff for the whole hotel was extremely outgoing and friendly. My only complaint would be the size of the swimming pool. It is impossible for an adult to spend any time in that pool. It is way too small to swim and the fact that there are numerous children in there makes it undesirable.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: We stayed on the 8th floor and the hotel moved us to a full ocean view room in the Diamond head tower. we were right over Waikiki beach looking down on the statue of Duke. Staff is well trained but expect a wait at the front desk any time of the day as they only keep two people at the front and one must be able to speak Chinese. The first floor is all shops so you do have to navigate a bit from the curb to get up to the lobby. The Spa is a nice facility with an accommodating staff, but the massages are more of a rub down with lotion. Pool is on the third floor and a bit on the smallish side. Elevators are very slow on the Diamond head tower.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: We had already been there in 2011 and I regret to say that, although it was partially renovated, the services are not improving while prices are!Breakfast: big hotel - big buffet, but expect long lines and a lot of pidgeons (I understand there is nothing they can do on this but waiters should be more proactive in driving away birds that eat and poo on tables and chairs). There were also cockroaches (see foto) but it seemed staff was not concerned a lot when we complained.Rooms: renovation brought cold colors but size is the big plus of this hotel: these are huge!

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: My husband and I spent a week in Waikiki at the Hyatt Regency. The hotel was conveniently located close to the beach. Rooms were clean. My only complaint would be the large crowds at the complimentary breakfast due to tour groups. These groups should be given a separate room for their breakfast.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: This Hyatt has it all including the premium location for a stay at Waikiki. Everything in Waikiki is walking distance and the beach is right across the street. The rooms are spacious and have a lanai.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: + location is excellent - right in front of the world famous Waikiki Beach, 1 minute walk crossing the street. Close to shops and restaurants. + service is very friendly and welcoming - we celebrated my husband's 60th birthday and they decorated our bed with orchid petals, wrote a sweet handwritten card and delivered a box of macadamia chocolates for us to enjoy+ hotel amenities are plenty - complimentary pineapple ice tea and fruit infused cold drink, complimentary use of beach gears including beach chairs/towels/snorkel/float that we enjoyed for hours at the beach, complimentary refillable water bottles and shopping bag, in-room slippers, toothbrush (I forgot to pack mine), and a printer at the check-in area to print your boarding pass. All of these are better than the other major hotel resort that we stayed at.+ plenty of seats to lounge around - we sat at the check-in area which has a balcony that overlooks Waikiki Beach, and there is the waterfall inside the hotel, making the lounging experience very relaxing

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: We stayed here three nights and it was one of the best experiences with hotels I've had while traveling. Every single staff member was great and made our stay in Honolulu a memorable one. The location couldn't be better as is it across the street from one of the world's most famous beaches.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Waikiki is wonderful. Group of 12 with 4 rooms in total, booked through travel company. The hotel is nice and clean, but the quality of room amenities does not live up to Hyatt standards for this price level. No additional acknowledgement for the guests that were World of Hyatt members. Did not allow to get credit for stay because booked with a over priced outside travel agency. Was denied early check for level due to claiming to be a Regency venue. If they are claiming to be Regency, they should meet Regency standards in the room. The only bar in the resort if the pool bar, went once, WORST drinks in Waikiki! Disappointed in Hyatt for this price level! Will choose another hotel chain on next trip.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: We chose Hyatt Regency Waikiki for a family Christmas trip for the location, which is directly across the beach, somewhat near the end of the Waikiki "strip." We just became Explorists, which is the middle tier for Hyatt members.The resort consists of 2 very tall towers, with a pool/bar in between. The resort has just about anything you want inside of it: car rental, spa, multiple clothing/gift stores, 3 ABC stores etc!The beach is just several steps away -- you can rent chairs and umbrellas, boogie boards, surfboards!We had certificates for the club lounge so we ate breakfast at the Regency Club often. It is basically a somewhat better continental breakfast with a different main option daily. We did not partake of the other restaurants.As Explorists we were all greeted with Leis - a nice touch. We had an ocean front room and we used points to get our 2 (adult) kids their own room.Elevators were relatively fast --only slow once or twice-- and we really heard no extraneous sounds.The room set up and decor with a light blue ocean color tone was lovely except for the large white stain in the carpet and some peeling paint/wallpaper. The hotel is a bit dated but that is really not a big deal except for the 2 issues in our room.The view from our room, ocean front--was spectacular -- and we had a 180 degree view!!We did the free outdoor yoga 2 mornings and it was great!!All in all, Hyatt Regency Waikiki was a very nice hotel in a great location!

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Our room and view were great but the check in process was unpleasant. We also expected a nicer/larger pool area and were disappointed with the small pool. The location is great though in proximity to the beach, shops and restaurants.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Loved the spacious room with gorgeous views and nice size Lanais for relaxing. Very friendly staff and everything you need is considered. Loved my stay that offered a comfortable bed, quiet room, and views of the beach and Diamond head too.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: This trip was for my mother-in-law's 60th birthday and first family trip since my husband and I got married. Staff there was going above and beyond to make us feel welcomed, and constantly checking on us to make sure our stays were comfortable and lovely. Also they are at prime location where everything is accessible and within <15-min walking distance. We've stayed at three different main hotels in Waikiki and they win the award for the best oceanfront view ever! Highly Recommend!

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Everything was great during our short stay. Maid service was prompt (especially compared to Hyatt Regency Maui). Excellent location across the street from the beach. Beach towels and chairs are always available at the pool. We were upgraded to an ocean view room and it had a balcony. It also had a washet toilet which was a nice touch.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Very nice hotel, hospitality went above and beyond my needs. Beautiful location right on the beach, and very close to shopping and attractions if you like that sort of thing. Would not hesitate to stay again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Location, location, location! Watched kids surf from room! Get club level access (food was amazing) room with Ocean View! Totally worth the $s. From checkin to dining to spa, every employee encountered was pleasant and made us feel apart of the family. Will definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: We arrived from Maui ready for the next part of our holiday, full of excitement, two seventeen year old males, hubby and I. When checking in we found that we had none of the rooms we had booked. To say I was frustrated and upset would be an understatement! After a tense few minutes, compromise was reached. From here on I can only praise the Front Desk Manager who turned everything around and from our experience over the next 6 nights I have to recommend this property, location, facilities, food and most of all very helpful and friendly staff. Can't wait for our return visit.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: PLEASE READ!!!!!! Let me start off by saying that my family always will stay at a Hyatt if possible because we have always had a great experience. That wasn’t the case the week of December 19! We had a trip planned to Waikiki for Christmas week for my family (12 adults and children). It was the worst vacation ever! The first room we walked into was absolutely disgusting, the walls were dirty, all the bathtub porcelain was chipping off. The bathroom door was broken and half spray-painted, there was a big green booger on the inside of the bathroom door. The patio door going outside to the patio was broke and didn’t want to open which caused me to break a nail upon arrival. I called management and they said that they were booked up and I would have to wait a day or two. Several days later they put us in a different room and it was just as disgusting. One of my other rooms they had giving me had this disgusting smell and we needed to be changed out of that room as well. I paid about $30,000 for this trip and the Hyatt Regency Waikiki ruined it! I have stayed in Motel 6 rooms that were nicer than this! The only person in management that was halfway hopeful was a woman from housekeeping. Nobody else cared. They don’t care if you are a loyal Hyatt member, not at this hotel anyways. I’m about to tell you the icing on the cake, after dealing with the nightmare of the rooms, they were offering catered Christmas dinner that a person would order ahead of time and pick up the morning of Christmas. We own a two bedroom condo at the Waikiki Beach Tower next-door so we were having our Christmas luncheon for 12 people next-door at noon. I ordered all of the catered food on Saturday and was assured that it would be ready for pick up Christmas day between 9 AM and 12 noon. The person that took my order gave me the wrong directions to where the food was to be picked up. That’s OK people make mistakes no big deal, let’s ask the next person we see if they can help us. The next person sent us to the opposite end of the property, needless to say there is no catering personnel there either. Long story short, we went through about eight different employees and nobody could tell us The correct location. It was blowing about 60 miles an hour and raining heavy. I was soaking wet because one of the employees of the Hyatt told me that the catering office was off of the property down the street so I went there as well with no luck. I had my hip replaced a couple months ago so this really took it’s toll on me. I finally got a hold of somebody who was willing to actually come help me find this place. Lo and behold, when we finally found somebody that could truly help, they told us they did not have my food reservation so they had nothing for me. I started looking for the food at 9 AM and now it is almost lunchtime. I have 11 hungry people waiting at the condo next-door for a fabulous Christmas dinner that is not coming. I was in tears, this is probably one of the only vacations where grandma would be able to be there and it was a disaster. I ended up having to get McDonald’s to feed everybody. $30,000 trip and we had McDonald’s for dinner, disgusting dirty rooms with green boogers on the doors! I have pictures that will blow your mind! Upon check out they offered me $100 food credit for all of my troubles LOL. Everybody at that hotel is oblivious to what is going on around there. I am still so very upset. One more fact to add, my family went to Waikiki last year and we got a room at the same hotel. Upon checking in my husband went to wash his hands in the bathroom. When he pulled out the white hand towel to dry his hands, a glass crank pipe fell out of the towel and shattered on the floor. We weren’t even in the room five minutes! We immediately called management and security came up with housekeeping and cleaned up the mess. So obviously whoever cleaned that room before us probably never even touched the folded hand towels so the housekeeping never switched them out and washed them, therefore the drug pipe was still hidden in the towel. I was mortified to say the least. Even if it looks like nobody used the bedding, or the towels in the bathroom, they still need to be switched out every time that room is re-rented. By the looks of all of their rooms they are used to cutting corners. I hope this helps as many of you will be checking into this hotel and have the same experience that I did. It’s a great location but the way they run their business is a dealbreaker. I hope this helps, I will upload some of the pictures from last year and this year.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: The hotel location is good, right next to Waikiki beach and good restaurant and shopping center nearby. Staff there is nice and helpful. You can borrow chair, swim ring and towel to go the the beach. The lounge service and food are good. I would recommend this hotel to others

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: My wife and I booked the Christmas buffet a month before we went to Hawaii but we weren't staying there.The food was of a good standard and an excellent variety. Not included is alcohol. Good service and very spacious. Overall, very happy with the meal.However, billed as a Christmas Buffet, no sight of any Christmas spirit anywhere, no carols, Christmas crackers, not even a Christmas tree. Big fail for me so no Christmas atmosphere.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: At first appearance the hotel does look dated especially the elevator but our room was gorgeous. The room was big and spacious with a beach view. The beach is literally across the street. If you love shopping and eating in Waikiki, please consider staying here. We did not opt for the lounge access though. I enjoyed by stay. Yes, walls are thin. Some guy was yelling in the middle of the night but can’t blame the hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: We were booked at the Hyatt Regency Waikiki by our travel agent and weren’t disappointed. After 9 hours on the plane we were excited to be on the ground for our first time in Hawaii. Our greeting from Sonia was warm and efficient and our room was superb. Breakfast was included each morning and the Shor staff were friendly and helpful. The pool is small and noisy with seating in demand but that didn’t detract from the fantastic time we had on our 5 day visit.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: After reading reviews, my expectations wet set low but I was wrong. The hotel is older but is well kept and good condition. Elevator wait was not long (longest maybe 5 minutes). We were upgraded with some ocean beach view and I loved sitting at the balcony overlooking the swimmers and surfers along Waikiki beach. Location is great being across street from beach and across street from cheapest surf rental (Moku) in area. The weather was unpredictable sometimes windy and on Christmas Day raining most of the day. Hawaii is nice but I’m glad I’m home.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Nice hotel directly across the street from the beach. Friendly, professional staff. This area of Waikiki has become very commercialized. If you like a city atmosphere with high-end shopping, this is the place for you.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: This is a great hotel to stay at if you're in Honolulu (especially for the Waikiki area). The hotel is directly across from the beach and a lot of the area attractions are within walking distance. The people working at the hotel were what made our stay more special. We received a room upgrade and a bottle of champagne at check-in because they knew we were there to celebrate our anniversary. Besides that, we received boxes to make our breakfasts to go the first morning because our sunrise trip to Pearl Harbor meant that we had to be at our meeting place at 5:45am (breakfast was available at 5:30am). Finally, we were also given a hospitality room on our last day after checking out and coming back from our day trip, all grimmy and exhausted. We were able to take our showers before going to the airport for our flight. Breakfast was delicious and the food selection was different daily. It was nice to be serenaded by ukulele songs while waiting for our elevators. The view from our hotel room was amazing.... Waikiki beach right in front and Diamond Head to the left from the balcony. Room was spacious and very clean. Thanks for making our first visit to Honolulu so special!

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Two major issues:1. Cockroach. We found cockroach inside the room. Only $100 credit were offered for compensation.2. Balcony door seal is old and not working. One day it’s very windy and the wind blew though the seal making big noise! Believe me it’s very loud and you can’t fall asleep. It’s our last night unfortunately, I called to make front desk know. And the lady told me they kind of know the issue already. Then why don’t act on it?! They didn’t seem too sorry for this and did not offer any compensation for us..The hotel location is nice and room type as well. But these are deal breakers I think in many peoples mind.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: The personalized service my family received while staying here was the best ever. Stacy Martin, the VIP manager was spot on with upgrades, free goodies, and personalized check in. My daughter is still confused on how her Dad received such personalized service. Thank you Stacy for the incredible service.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: My husband and I spent a week at the Hyatt celebrating my birthday. We have chosen this hotel for it’s position first of all which is very convenient. Once we arrived we have been welcomed at the check in by Chrea who was the sweetest and most professional receptionist we ever met! Giving us all the good information we needed she definitely helped us to make the most of the hotel facilities and good tips about the island. The staff at the hotel is very welcoming and nice, rooms are spacious and clean, pools Are lovely, especially the jacuzzi on a cloudy day or in the evening, breakfast is delicious, valet parking a bit expensive but very efficient, we just didn’t like drinks and food at the pool, too price and not tasting good. But overall it was a great experience that we recommend and would definitely repeat!
