hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Great hotel and location, staff are friendly and helpful.The rooms are clean and comfortable, the bathrooms are a little on the small size but the room’s themselves are a good size.Fantastic coffee shop in the ground floor.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: I enjoyed my stay. It was absolutely beautiful and the hotel was very accommodating. Location was geat and the view was right off the beach. My family really had a great time. Room was very spacious and comfy.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Stayed here last week and honestly cant complain. Yes the resort fee is lame and expensive and that would be my only gripe.I normally stay on the hilton hawaiian side so this was my first time on this side of Waikiki. It was this or the outrigger waikiki beach. Ive been very happy with my stays at previous Hyatt Regency properties. Ive read all the recent reviews on the hotel from the construction noise, the dirty rooms, the nonchalant staff, and especially those elevators. I was very apprehensive and told my wife to expect waits. I am happy to say i didnt have to eait more then 2 or 3 minutes and that was rally during the mornings around 730-8AM.We also met the ukelele guy and he was awesome. My kids totally loved listening to him and interacting with him. Now my oldest wants to learn the uke instead of the violin...We booked a ocean view room and we were situated in the diamond head tower however we were facing towards the beach vs diamondhead. The lanai was a generous size and I spent lots of time out there either watching the sunset or eating.Location is super walkable as mentioned i normally stay om the otherside of waikiki so its atleast a 20 minute walk to get to anywhere. Here i can just go down stairs and be in the middle of everything! The trolley is easy to get to as the stop is roght across the street. Me's bbq js a block away and was my goto for breakfast everyday.Yes you can hear some construction noise but it wasn't that bad, hey you are in the middle of a city..close the sliding doors and itll cut out most of it.The only thing that was not enjoyable was on the last night some loud ass domestic abuser checked into the room beside us at 12am and was yelling at his gf or wife. I had to call security twice to tell them to quiet down. So happy that was our last night.The pool guys were great as well, i think it was robert who gave my kids some freezies as well, mahalo brah!It was a shame that someone had an accident in the pool as well...it didnt reopen the rest of the day.Loved the water bottles, kids insisted we bring them home to remind them of our trip.We did not eat at any of the restaurants on site only got coffee downstairs at kai coffee.There is also a farmers market couple of times a week...but meh just browsed and quickly moved on.Bidet is greatbin the washroom and house keepong was prompt.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: We started out Honeymoon here and it was the perfect start to the trip! Great location for walking around the shops. I also was able to walk Diamondback from here. Across from beach was great to. The staff was the best part however! They were so friendly and helpful, I wish I could name them all but they were everywhere :) Thank you Hyatt Regency Waikiki!

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: We came here for our honeymoon, and our room was fantastic! They decorated our room with flowers and gave us free champagne, leis and a chocolate cake. We bumped into their “Director of Rooms” on the second day, I think his name was Don, he said he came from Toronto (we remembered because that’s where we’re from as well). Don was walking all over the hotel observing and asking customers how their experience was at the hotel, that’s the level of seriousness they take with their customers. We mentioned our fridge was not cold enough and our fruits and milk were going bad. By nighttime on the same day when we returned from sightseeing, another fridge was in our room. During our stay they were repairing the elevators which was a bit annoying because with the fewer working elevators, sometimes we had to wait 5-10 mins, we reflected this to Don and the next day we noticed they opened the freight elevators as well so we no longer had to wait. Aside from the great customer service, the hotel was in a great location, right on Waikiki beach, we only had to walk like four minutes to our surfing lesson. Rooms were modern and clean with Japanese electronic toilet. Also to note was I loved their breakfast buffet and the dinner buffet! It was delicious and had a wide variety. Their Aloha Friday show was also wonderful, where they had dancers and workshops where I got to make my own haku and lei!

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: The hotel is right across the street from the beach, not right on it, has towels but no beach chairs. We had a high room with a gorgeous view of the water including rainbows. The pool is smallish, lots of kids having a good time which is fine by me, and the valet service for the car was quick. Employees trying hard to please! They were renovating elevators but turned out not to be a problem for us.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Would highly recommend staying at the Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach for any holiday. We were there for a week and now have thoughts for another trip. The resort is located in a central position that is ideal for any visitor.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Room was spacious and updated. Nice view of the beach. Sliding door was thick so barely heard any outside noise like cars honking and people yelling. Our room had a king size bed plus lounging sofa with still plenty of space.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Unobstructed view of beach and very close to shops, restaurants and food courts. There is a shopping mall within the premises and an onsite spa. The resort is outdated but the customer service and location outweighed this

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Worst room ever. My husband and i have stayed here 3 times total with our children and room 1416 was the worst and nastiest room out of thr three. I understand rooms are stayed in steadily, but for what Hyatt charges for this resort per night, I expected better, and I’ve seen the two-star hotels in the better corner. The walls and door had peeling paint, the edges and wall were dirty, the vent had large amounts of trapped dust, the tub and fixtures were rusted to the point i didn't want my children to bathe in the tub. Just overall disgusting. When a room looks like this, the overall amenities mean nothing.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: I stayed here for two nights prior to boarding a cruise ship.Whilst the hotel has a great location, it looks and feels dated in both the public areas and guest rooms.My room had a side view of the promenade, with an easily accessible balcony. The room was very clean and spacious. The bed, air conditioning and good sound insulation provided great conditions for sleep...if you aren't jet lagged! The staff I came across were very good and diplomatic! I didn't try any of the other facilities available in the hotel complex as I felt ripped off by the "resort tax" which amounted to 85$ for a two night stay. Within my bedroom was a note outlining what I got for this extra payment. I have stayed in many a hotel and have not been faced with this nonsense. I don't mind paying up front for what i perceive to be fair and just..but this, no way.This resort will not be visited again by myself unless this situation changes

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: This hotel was very nice. Close to a lot of eateries. Lots of places to shop right in and around the entire hotel. The beach is right across the street. It’s a short walk to the beach and the park is right up the road. The pool is also nice.Very good fitness center

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Let me start with the goods - the location is excellent. That's where the good list ends. The hotel is dated, probably never renovated since 1980s. Their are almost no amenities of use so charging $50 resort fee is a rip off. The elevator has a displayed graph of wait times that goes up-to 15-20 mins during most time of day like breakfast, morning, afternoon or evening. The rooms were very spacious, being Explorist we were upgraded to 29th floor and views were great. However, the ambience of room and quality of decor, elevator, lobby and pretty much entire building made it look like 70s and not lively at-all.The regency club is a big joke. They literally had 2 cookies in the name of dessert during evening and cheap quality alcohol as "paid" drinks from 7-8:30pm. Breakfast was also what you expect from Best Western style motel and not from Category 5. Talk about the Pool which doesn't exists. My building has better 24/7 pool. Overall, don't go here and rather go to better places like Sheraton Waikiki which has way better amenities and value for money.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Alesea and the VIP Guest were amazing. The housekeeping and front office staff were incredible accommodating and welcoming. This is a first class resort from top to bottom. The guest experience was incredible and under the management of Irby Morvant, the staff makes this property is the ultimate resort

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: This place is just across the bridge. On the ground level there good shops. Staff are very friendly and helpful.You can access your google chrome compatible apps but not so easy to connect but it will. Driving to Peking stall is really hard.Stay quality is very nice.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Get the Ocean Front Room if you can afford it, so worth waking up to that view. I stay here for the location, near all the shopping, restaurants, beach and easy access to highway for sightseeing the island. Also this Hyatt has a great breakfast buffet.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: We were there for our daughter's Winter Ball being held in their ballroom. Great location and the hotel has everything you need right there in their mall (food, shopping, etc). With the World of Hyatt app, booking, check-in and check-out was very easy.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: whether in Hawaii for work or vacation, can't go wrong with the beautiful Hyatt Regency. Staff is always welcoming, professional, and helpful. I have stayed at this hotel many times over the past several years and it never disappoints - highly recommend!

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Everything about this hotel is great if you are just on a vacation and do not mind hearing everything from the hallway, conversation your next door guests are having, TV they are watching...etc. For a light sleeper like myself, I woke up every hour. My rooms were paid for but I would not spend well over $350 (room, taxes, resort fee, parking) a night and don't even get a complimentary breakfast. I've stayed at other Hyatt's on Waikiki and it is much better.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Ideal location, friendly service. Being a world of hyatt member big plus. Room was very spacious for waikiki hotel. Manager offered us room upgrade and late late check out ( had late flight back to seattle )

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Mixed reviews on this hotel but that being said the staff went out of their way to correct service issues. Feels like it is a hotel that is working out kinks. Located across the street from the beach. Great views from room if you have oceanfront. Pool service was very good and I rented a Cabana. Pool food is excellent and locally sourced. Cabana was great for some added privacy. Call ahead and rent #1 or #4 for best beach view from the Cabana. Issue with room type upon check in. Was not really oceanfront. First room was supposed to be an ocean front and was actually ocean view even after paying for upgrade. Front desk manager responded when I complained and made it right. High floor and diamond tower seem to be the best to get away from city construction noise and main traffic sounds. Buffet was really great for dinner with king crab, sushi, pasta, soups, prime rib, kimchi’s, dessert etc! Breakfast had lots of choices and beware of the pigeons. They are aggressive and entertaining, It’s expensive but for what you get it’s a great deal. We had other issues and I would consider the hotel again simply because the management responded so well. Room was a good size, great ac, lots of in room amenities and coffee in the room. Every staff member at this property was genuinely nice and friendly. Lots of nice shops on property and walking distance to many malls and restaurants. Live music at the swim bar nightly and great location

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: When you arrive the valet will be overwhelmed with 20 cars. There will be no directions to the front desk and if you need to use the restroom you can forget about it. Then the escalator will be out of order and there will be a sign by the elevator telling you there is a 15 minute wait during peak hours. And if you think you get any special treatment as a Globalist well forget about it as your room will have a tiny ledge that will scare the hell out of you if you try to see the beach. Then just try to walk anywhere in this rat maze as it is perhaps the most congested convoluted shifts how of a design ever reeked upon humanity. I told my wife if I owned this FUBAR property I would just blow it up and start all over. It’s just that bad!
user_name:
Jolly B
San Francisco, California, United States

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: comfortable and spacious room. The buffet although good was a little expensive. Lots of other places to eat in Waikiki that are more reasonable. The pool was a little small for the size of the resort. Elevators were a little slow at least in the Waikiki tower. Parking was expensive at $41.00 per day and the guest parking lot was small with small stalls.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Elevators and escalators did not work. Did Not receive the room we wanted.Would of liked to have known elevators and construction was going on in hotel during our stay. Would of liked to of gotten ocean front room per our reservation

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: The escalator was not working. The stairs were dirty and so were the carpets. It is not worth $300 per night. Valley is too expensive and too slow. Birds were all over at the breakfast buffet. I didn’t get the room, I wanted.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: My family and I stayed at Hyatt Waikiki to visit our son who is attending the University of Hawaii. The Hyatt Waikiki is my top choice due to the attentiveness of the staff and great location across the street from the beach.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: We were only there for one night, flew into Honolulu basically to see Pearl Harbor the next morning and then head on to Maui but I'm glad we stayed here. Great location right across from the beach. The room was beautiful and we had a great view, even though it was partial oceanview. We didn't check out the spa but we did try one of the restaurants and there was a lot of food options and it was yummy.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: This hotel stay was a bit misleading when we booked. It’s not ON the beach, but across the street from the beach (only a few in Waikiki are truly beachfront). We booked a room with Ocean View, but that was a room directly facing the other tower of the hotel - with a view of the ocean if you lean out. If you want to see the ocean, make SURE you book Ocean FRONT. Felt like that was misleading. That all being said, location is pretty darn good for Waikiki and for what you pay.The staff are incredibly helpful and will go out of their way to help you - none of our issues came from the staff.Don’t let the photos fool you - this is an old hotel and it shows in the rooms and amenities. They have tried to do surface level improvements but the carpets, walls and floors are pretty gross. Stains, streaks, spills, etc.Food is unbelievably overpriced - just leave the hotel to find better food for cheaper. Don’t fall for the buffet prices.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: My wife and I stayed at Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa for thanksgiving weekend. Prior to our arrival I received an email from Stacey, the VIP manager that she asked if there was anything we needed to arrange upon our arrival. The checkin process was extremely fast and easy. Olivia checked us in in no time with a big smile. The room was spacious and clean. The bathroom and shower were spotless and the view from the room was perfect. The hotel location is great. We didn't use the beach in front of the hotel and explored other beaches, but if you want to use the beach it's just 20 step from the hotel. I strongly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: I would love to take this chance to thanks Stacey Martin, the VIP manager who sent us emails ahead of time, asking if we are celebrating anything, our preference, as well as arrival time. She treat us as family members, and sent warm text msg just one day before we arrived. During our check in, she greet us with local flowers rings and her warm smile. We are so touched by her warmness and kindness. Stacey is also very considerate preparing us with champion, chocolate and welcome cards in the room. Everything is perfect and we love the upgraded room with ocien view. The room service and overall property is also amazing. We fully enjoy our 2 days stay there and would definitely come back! We won't hesitate to recommend this place to our friends and family.Thanks,Di

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Loved the Hyatt. Very comfortable, quiet and conveniently located. The room was well appointed and spacious with plenty of counter space and outlets, the beds were very plush which made for a very restful night. Having a balcony was wonderful as well. And having a laundry room available for guests payable by credit card was so convenient. I really felt at home there. Additionally, the ground level open air plaza had some great little coffee spots, ABC stores and a few other shops- and many more shops outside on Kalakawa, the main boulevard that runs parallel to the beach. If you want to rent surfboards or boogie boards cheaper than the rentals on the beach, go to Moku's located across the street from the valet/entrance to the Hyatt on Koa.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: The best in the world...I had fun, a great team approach to service and a very warm staff made the differences in each day.I also appreciate the valet team and the caring people services contributed to k8ndness and true hospitality.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Excellent hotel and stayExcellent staff, great viewGreat location, just steps from the beach, usually I have a hard time sleeping in a hotel, not here, slept like a baby. What a relaxing experience. Loved our stay

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Stay in this property for four nights with Globalist status. get upgraded to the diamond head tower to enjoy both view of waikiki beach and the diamond head in higher floor. VIP manager, Stacey gave me a nut lei as welcome gift. Even though this property doesn't right on the waikiki beach, but it is just across the street and the hotel offers towel and beach chair for you to bring to waikiki beach, very convenient. The lounge provides standard hyatt regency breakfast, but they prepare miso soup and white rice for Japanese, and Asian guests, which is a big plus. the main dish in the evening happy hours are delicious and with variety from day to day. it is located right on the main street so that you can go dining/ shopping around by walk. The only drawback is that there is only one water refill station in the hotel. We need to take elevator every day to the 3F to refill water before starting our daytime trip.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: We have a GREAT time, hotel is perfectly located for easy access to beaches, restaurants and retail shopping. Staff was EXCEPTIONAL, rooms are clean and well maintained. Definitely a trip to remember.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: We had an ocean view room on a high floor - the room was spacious, clean and modern, and we were very happy with the room itself. However there are 2 things to be aware of:1. We had booked an ocean view room on the basis that we would be getting a view similar to that shown on their website for a "2 Queen Beds with Ocean View, High Floor" room which showed mostly a beach/ocean view. However, all of the view from the room was of the tower opposite and it was only when we walked onto the balcony that there was an ocean view on the left. When we asked at reception about this, as we thought that we'd been allocated an incorrect room, they advised that that is in fact an ocean view room. We asked if we could be relocated to a room with a view as shown on their website but were told that there were no rooms available for the duration of our stay. From what we could see, it would seem that the room next to ours and the two next to that would be rooms with views similar to the website picture,but ours was not. If I was booking again, and wanted an ocean view, I would be specifying that I wanted a room with an ocean view the same as that advertised. 2. Construction has started on a building on an adjacent block and construction noise (including rockbreakers) started at about 7.30 to 8am each day. Since the building isn't yet out of the ground, I imagine that that noise is going to continue for some time. They do provide earplugs and a suggestion for a white noise app :)

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: I stayed at Hyatt Waikiki Resort and Spa for a couple of nights in November. In summary, it was an outstanding experience. Here are some details that you may like to know:Room & Amenities:Thanks to Hyatt Explorist membership, during my first stay I got upgraded to the penthouse on the 39th floor, facing the Waikiki beach. I had three open balconies with a heavenly view from the Diamond Head to the end of the Waikiki beach.During the second stay, I got upgraded to a room on the 38th floor, with an excellent view of Diamond Head.Very nicely appointed rooms with relevant amenities. Rooms were spacious and very well laid out. The bathroom had a shower, full-size bathtub and a toilet. Restaurant & Bar:I did not get a chance to use restaurant and Bar at the hotel. Looking at the long queues, I can imagine these must be good.Shops and Cafes:Hyatt Waikiki has several shops and cafes in the hotel, so it is easy for guests to choose where and how they would like to enjoy their time in Waikiki. Additionally, Guests can avail services from various travel and tourism service providers located within the Hyatt premises. Access:Access to the Hyatt Waikiki from Honolulu Airport smooth with a taxi ride of 30 minutes during non-peak hours. During peak hours it may take an hour. Service & Staff:Staff members were accommodating to serve guests with Hyatt quality. I would particularly like to highlight Kayla and Olivia, who welcomed me during my first stay and made me feel at home. It was good to get a lei around my neck and to experience the Hawaiian hospitality at the Hyatt. I faced no problems during check-in, checkout or requests made from my room. When I visit Hawaii next time, I will be staying at Hyatt Waikiki again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Came back to our room one afternoon to find our safety box wide open and our passcode reset, and our cash stock lighter Not unequivocally accusing but this felt really strange. It’s probably not the best idea to leave cash in these boxes in any hotel but I’d strongly advise against it here

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Been coming to Hyatt Waikiki since 2014. Got married at Hyatt in 2016. So we have roots in this hotel. The staff hands down is the reason we return. I have stayed at better locations: Moana surfrider, Sheraton and Royal Hawaiian. But I still choose Hyatt regency above all for their ohana feel. They keep us returning. Regency club was great. Only knock was this only club room I had to pay for drinks. Still good experience overall. The Buffet the food quality was superb but me and the wife don’t get our 70 dollar per person value. But great service overall.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: View wasn't great, experienced a very rude staff. I wouldn't go back to this place.. I feel like if I spent the same money into another hotel, I'd have a lot better experience. Went to the pool bar and my straw flew off because of wind. I asked my server another straw and the bartender said "why do I have to give you another straw? I can wash it for you but we don't give you another straw." I understand it was because of the souvenir cup or whatever. I didn't want to bring the cup anyways. I just wanted another Damm straw!!! Her attitude was beyond rude.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: I really enjoyed my stay. The hotel room was very large and clean. My partial ocean view was great and it was so fun to people watch from the lanai. The staff were great and very accommodating. The hotel was located near great shops and restaurants and the beach is just a hop across the street. Would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: We had the most amazing stay here!! Will always go back for our Waikiki visits. The staff was awesome, bell hop was superb. The pool was so refreshing and the views were priceless!! Thank you Hyatt Regency!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Stacy - VIP Manager is a hero! Upon my arrival I had several challenges and over the course of my stay she continued to follow up with me to ensure my Hyatt experience was superb! If this is a Hyatt standard, I will always return!

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: This was my 10th time @ this property, it was a wonderful visit as always. Regency Club was well stocked and I was able to to make a meal out of the breakfast items offered and even in thee evening, could also eat enough to call it dinner I highly recommend this property.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: We had a view of the beach and watched the perfect ocean and surfers from our balcony. The room was lovely. Staff were excellent: we forgot something and they were able to post it to us free of charge. The Would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Terrible - stay away! Other than a good location opposite the beach ( not even on the beach) - nothing here is worth the money. It’s like a 2-3 star hotel - terrible front desk who don’t want to help with anything, rooms are run down, bath room is like a narrow bathroom, elevators have 5-10 minutes wait every time. Go to any other hotel - this one is not worth the money.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Stunning view of Waikiki Beach from our private balcony. Great location right in the center of Waikiki & famous Kalākaua Ave for shopping & evening strolling. Short walking distance to every major activities in Waikiki. Vallet staffs were so friendly & helpful. Highly recommended & definitively come back for a visit again in the near future.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: The Regency Club staff are the best. The Front Desk, Pool, and Housekeeping staff are excellent as well. Everyone is friendly, helpful, and efficient. They are truly like family, as many employees know me on a first-name basis.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: We were so happy with our stay here for our anniversary. We were made to feel special from beginning to end, with flowers on the bed, chocolates in the room, and a very nice bottle of wine delivered to the room. They also upgraded our room from a partial ocean view to a full ocean view. The room was clean, spacious, and the bedding comfortable. Thank you so much Hyatt!

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Very friendly staff, and great hotel.Unfortunately the outside table was never cleaned properly, floor was filthy as birds come and poop all over. Very annoying birds in morning could be resolved with a temporary net on top of actual tent. Baby high chair we’re very gross. Construction around and bar with box noise outside at night.Otherwise great stay, comfortable bed and room. Staff very helpful

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Just returned from a family trip in Honolulu. Regret choosing to stay at the Hyatt Regency.Booked 3 rooms for 3 nights.Even in the higher levels the construction noise and wind noise coming through the vent is annoying.The rooms are a bit tired, chipped paint, broken cabinet doors etc. The elevator is very slow and shaky. Ocean view room is really a partial ocean view, if you step out onto the balcony you can see the ocean. Wasn't worth the price at all.The room was half way cleaned when we got there. Wet rag on the chair, no amenities, coffee or tea in the room. This was taken care of right away by Shelbie from housekeeping, the only positive interaction with a staff during our stay.One of the rooms they put us in was right next to the elevator, the low humming noise kept me up all night and had to ask to change rooms. They wanted us out of the room by 11am so they could clean it and give it to another guest. But the new room wouldn't be ready until after 3pm. So we had to pack our luggage and go out.The worst part of this hotel is the rudeness of the front desk staff.Kathie, who checked us in, was unfriendly to say the least. No smiles, just tired of dealing with guests. She shoved leis onto my family members and walked off. Olivia at the front desk was beyond rude. We were going to the beach and wanted to ask where we could get towels. She was off to the side not helping anyone so my brother said "Excuse me", she yells back very rudely "I'm not ready, wait in line". Didn't feel welcome here at all. No aloha spirit at this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: I was pleasantly surprised by my experience at the Hyatt Regency Waikiki hotel. I always like Hyatt Regencies, but this one is special. First off, my room was large, very well-appointed, and, from the balcony, I had a view of the ocean. The mountain and city view I had from the room was also very attractive. I had asked *only* for a truly quiet room, because I have been unwell and really needed my sleep. And sure enough, with the patio door closed the room was nearly silent! I slept extremely well there. I paid a very fair Hyatt member rate and I feel like I got a great value.The room had everything a hotel should offer, and then some: the bed, a king, was appropriately firm, level, and even expensive-feeling. In my youth I sold furniture and beds and l am very particular, so you can take that to the bank - the beds are NICE. Well-padded, but not soft and squishy like all the "pillow-top" beds they foist on you nowadays. There are bidet-style washing jets in the toilet, lots of towel bars (a must!), great water pressure, and a really nice shower with a hand-held sprayer, an adjustable-height shower, and a high overhead rainfall shower, too. PLUS a tub with a regular faucet if you want to take a bath, instead.What really made my stay great was the kindness and friendliness of the staff. It began with Kouji, the bell-man who got me settled in. He saw I was traveling alone and he kindly sent me a gift basket with coffee and jam and chips and some amazing Hawaiian cookies and macadamia chocolates. I was touched by his thinking to do that for me. He must be a favorite around there, he seems like a real people person.My trip was to help a family member no-one has seen in 40 years, my youngest brother. It was challenging. Basically, other than family-related chores, I was all alone at the hotel for 8 days and nights. I missed my husband and my cats, terribly. So the people working at the Regency Club made a big difference in how I felt every day. Takumi and Cary and James and all the beautiful young ladies there always had a smile for me, and sometimes tried to tempt me to eat more treats, another serving of pasta or salad before the buffet closed, or maybe have a little glass of Crown Royal. Takumi even recommended me to his own Realtor, who was able to help me find some rental houses. I am applying online today to rent a cottage near Chinatown for my brother. Without Takumi's Realtor, I would have had to work with a stranger. I'm sure I would not have gotten the personalized service someone with a local reference enjoys.Moving on, the fish tacos at the pool are wonderful, and Barbara my waitress was quite a character. Seeing the interest the pigeons had in my lunch the first day I ate pool-side, she gave me a squirt bottle and told me to just aim at them, but don't pull the trigger, and they will fly off! Sure enough, Barbara had them well-trained. They waddled away from the bottle and my commands to, "go on, buddies"! They seem to learn who is on to them, because they didn't really try after that day! No bottle needed. The view from the pool is lovely, and I am ashamed to say I was spoiled by the service and comfort and never went the extra 100 feet to the beach. The Waikiki famous beach ...I got an email from the director of rooms, Donald Kim, asking about my stay. He seemed interested in my questions and observations. It feels like there must be good leadership at the hotel, since how else could they keep as many very long-term employees as I met there? I could go on, but just want to say that my trip was made bearable by the hotel's wonderful features and amenities, and, most especially, by their employees. They are fine representatives of Hyatt hotels, the kind of people who make a traveler feel loyal to their brand.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: This Hotel is a resort style hotel and is a great place to stay for business or leisure. It is in a great location of Honolulu with in-house and just outside the property places to shop and eat. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Hotel is perfectly located near Diamond Head and across from Waikiki beach. The club lounge serve great food 24 hours a day, in which I used to save on $$. I did splurge in the Buffet which was very expensive. I would recommend the Buffet only if you like crab to make it worth the high price of admission.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Location of the resort is very good right in the middle of Waikiki but that is we’re it ends...the wait time for breakfast is 20 mins to half an hour just to get a seat.for the size of the resort the breakfast dinner is tiny with only 1 toliet for the whole breakfast facility.wait time for the lifts were at least 15 mins and the line was huge all the time.also to order a 10 year old movie on the television is 20 usd and that’s only for the day.also asked for a roll out bed for our 3 year old son and the resort wanted $95usd per night!!! And $48 usd a day for the resort fee is an absolute joke For what they offer. Will not stay here again,overpriced,outdated,the whole place is catered for Japanese tourists.if you are thinking about staying here think again

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: This was my 5th visit to these paradise islands, but my first to the Hyatt Regency propery. We stayed a week in a room on the 36th floor. First, after a 10 hour flight, was told my room was of Waikki 'mountains??!! Paid for (thru Delta vacations) for what i thought would be a beach view. Don't believe it was the fault of Hyatt but will pursue that matter through Delta Vacations. I had a preconcieved mental vision of what a Hyatt property should be and wasn't disappointed with the main lobby atmosphere etc. The problem began with the reduced elevator service (due to one out for assumed maintenance) and the general apperance of the room. This room showed wall (paper) scares and worn carpet. When much time is spent in ones room, it should reflect the amazing Hawaiian experience without issue. My applause to the overall staff/team though of this Hyatt. They absolutely made up for the aging lady's issues and wrinkles.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Love staying at the Hyatt Regency Waikiki. This was our 3rd stay. The rooms are large and clean, the staff are wonderful and the views of the beach can’t be beat. Having so many shops downstairs is very handy, especially the ABC shop for last minute supplies. It’s very central to everything. We never found the lifts an issue. Love the complimentary beach towels and chairs. Can’t wait to come back in April next year.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: We stay here every time and always 100% happy.Beautiful ocean and Main Street people watching views. Awesome poolside food/drink service. Free towels and beach chairs and not even 100 metres to one of the most beautiful beaches in the world.Directly across the road from the Duke statue.Awesome sushi restaurant out front of this hotel and great cafe downstairs - Koa Coffee Cafe. So central to all you need for a fantastic relaxing holiday. We will be back in March April 2020 and can’t wait. Mahalo from Aussies in Brisbane QLD.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: The location of this hotel is fantastic, easy walking to most Waikiki area amenities. This is a large hotel complex and it will take you several minutes to leave your room and get onto the street. The views from the upper levels are stunning.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Really surprised at positive reviews. Service really poor (except for nice guy serving us drinks at pool in evening), breakfast below sub ordinary, check out an unpleasant experience. Needs some service work.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: We had several billing issues with the hotel and some got sorted out and some didn’t. - resort fees - the hotel lied about the fact that it’s Hyatt’s corporate policy to charge resort fees at the time of check in even though it was a prepaid stay. Ultimately they waived off half the resort fees after lot of back and forth but Hyatt corporate opened a case for me to get back the rest of the amount which they never replied to. Still waiting for the 386$ to come back. - club - we were specifically told that the club includes alcohol and then we were told no, it doesn’t. - food - had asked for a veg burger and was given a non veg one. Had disputed this charge but have still been charged. - general resort - the pool is way too small and in general the property looks pretty tired for the amount they charge.Will surely not come back here.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: This hotel is conveniently located in the middle of Waikiki- right across from the beach but surrounded by shopping, restaurants and a great view of the ocean.The staff there will greet you with Aloha and are very helpful. The one downside is that finding the front desk can be a little hard. It’s located on the second floor but I found the signage wasn’t very clear.There are two towers to this resort with many shops on site and a restaurant on the 3rd floor.I’m happy there was a shopping on the premise as I needed some emergency last minute items for an event I was attending.You can find live entertainment on certain times of the day to give the aloha experience from singing trios and hula dancing in the main foyer on the ground floor.Being a local island boy myself, I found some really great food with in the vicinity at made me feel very much at home.My favorite part was the young man playing ukulele at the elevators, very friendly and helpful to the guests.The rooms were very comfortable though I will say the walls are a bit thin, I could hear the footsteps of the guests around or above me but that wasn’t too much of a negative for me.The room attendants were super nice making sure I had everything I needed.I hope you have fun on Oahu!

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Beautiful stay at this hotel. The service was excellent. We felt welcome the minute we got there and everybody was helpful. We were greeted with leis, and were offered a bottle of champagne for our honeymoon. The hotel was so conveniently located in Waikiki, just across the street from the beach. The room was very spacious and bright. If you were to lose your luggage coming to Oahu, this would be a great spot to stay. On the hotel grounds, there are shops, restaurants, cafés, a spa, everything you need. We received two reusable water bottles that we could refill. Very useful for our day trips. The beach chairs and towels were so convenient; we borrowed some every day. The pool area looks a little run down. There is a huge bird issue in that area...the birds will dive and fight for bits of food if there are any left around the pool area. Something should be done about the birds. Overall, we had a great time and would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: My dad and I came to Waikiki for a few days and wanted to relax at an Oceanside resort. I was under the impression the Hyatt would be right on the beach and would provide us with a relaxing stay. The hotel was a bit different than what we expected. They are working on the elevators so during peak times it can take a few minutes to get an elevator. The hotel is across from the beach. Not right on it. There were towels and chairs available by the pool which was nice. The restaurants in the hotel were basically just the pool bar and the buffet. We upgraded to have access to the regency club which was great for breakfast and to avoid the long lines at the buffet. Granted it was $50 a day but we figured it evened out if we were to pay for 2 people for breakfast. Our ocean view room was fine, but for $529 a night I was disappointed with the size of the bathroom. Luckily, it was just 2 people because I’m not sure we could’ve made a room of that size work with more than that. There was no mini bar in the room but they did give us reusable bottles to fill with water. Lots of places to walk to and the concierge was very helpful. Overall: I was not thrilled with this Hyatt Regency. Maybe my expectations were too high because my last Hyatt stay was the park Hyatt in Tokyo. The location is great but the room lacked elements. The saving grace is the customer service. All the employees went above and beyond to help answer any questions we had. If we were a family with young kids I think my review would be different. But as we are older and wanted more of a resort feel, this location didn’t meet those standards. We still had a wonderful time and would recommend!

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: We stayed on the 31st floor over the Halloween week. There was active construction going on right outside our window/balcony. Halloween night was also super noisy - the hotel had a party downstairs in the pool area that lasted until 2am! Even with earplugs in, I wasn't able to sleep. Hotel restaurants were overpriced; you can definitely find better food for a better price at local restaurants.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency over the birthday of my husband with access to the club lounge. The service was from the beginning to the end outstanding (probably the best we have ever had). The room on the 28th floor had a balcony with a wonderful view on the sea. The location is perfect, just next to Waikiki beach. The rooms need an upgrade for the price paid, but the perfect service more than overcompensated that...do 5 out of 5 points from us.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: The hotel is nice, well maintained and the rooms are well-appointed and the staff are friendly.However, the gripes and there are a few, are as follows. The lifts are terrible it will take forever for a lift and after a big day of tours or shopping, you're in no mood to wait in a queue for 5-15 minutes for a lift to your room, not to mention that if you need to get to a tour, make sure you leave your room 15 minutes at least before you planned to, because there's no guarantee of getting a lift in time to make your transport. The laundry onsite is terrible, there are 5 washing machines and 5 dryers FOR THE ENTIRE HOTEL and people often leave their clothes in there and don't/forget to take them out and the hotel is unable to do anything about it. Lastly, but most importantly, what stuck out to me and my travelling party was that if you're not Japanese or Chinese, you're money doesn't count for anywhere near as much as theirs. You will get rooms on a lower level, they also have their own private bar/entertainment area which they can only get into. Once I saw this, I made a point of eating/spending money anywhere else but the hotel. My travelling party and I will never stay at this hotel again.At the end of the day, there are many other hotels in the Waikiki area which will be much more suited for you and your family than this place if you're not Japanese or Chinese, please find them because this is not the place for you.
user_name:
BigKostdog
Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: This place is complicated to be a popular resort.Hotel staff are also picky.Hotel club lounge breakfast was also expected.Of course, the price is very expensive too. It was less than expected for the Hyatt Regency brand

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: A bit late about the review. Earlier this year I stayed there for one week with my wife for honeymoon, as well as my parents-in-law to celebrate anniversary. Perfect location and rooms - just walk across the street to reach beach, and walk distance to nearby shopping centers and plazas, not to mention the room condition etc - comparing the other hotel we stayed earlier(It's probably better to not mention the name here..), definitely worth it! Stacey Martin kindly reached us early and helped us a lot along the way to arranging rooms and everything, thus we deeply feel the welcoming when we get into the hotel & rooms. Thanks Stacey!One thing is the lounge service there is a bit simple - we are both explorist elites and used lounge access award to expect at least a nice breakfast, but not really. I love the rest area and balcony, but food is a bit simple and mostly cold, not even very basic choices like scrambled egg etc. You'd probably consider to having breakfast outside instead if you stay there for a week like me.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: I am a return guest to Hyatt Regency Waikiki. That speaks volumes- doesn’t it!?Grace at check-in delivers outstanding customer service. Location brilliant. The Shor breakfast is very extensive. Staff at Shor Restaurant and Bell desk/room service very pleasant and helpful.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: We love staying here. Rooms are so spacious and super clean as you would expect from a Hyatt Regency. You can’t beat the location. I love the DH tower for the view of Diamond Head but love the Ewa tower for the convenience of getting to the pool and shops.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: There is construction close by. It is really noisy.Also the standard ocean view will cost you extra $50, but you don't get to see the ocean until you're in balcony and you just see a piece of ocean. It's not really worth the money.In addition to resort fee, there are other sees combined that will cost you $40~ for a day of stay that you need to be aware of.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: My wife and I stayed for just one night (Halloween) and as locals know, it's Waikiki's craziest night. Hyatt had the best Halloween party on the pool deck with excellent beverage service and below expected prices!

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: As a Kamaaina and having grown-up in Hawaii I always had a perception Waikiki Hotels. Our experience was AWESOME. We are World of Hyatt members but once contact was made by VIP services by Ms. Martin our overnight stay-cation was AWESOME.Only drawback was the servicing of the elevators in the Tower we were assigned to, but the Ocean View as more than enough to make up for that.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Stacy Martin was so helpful prior to check in. I had several Questions that she had immediate answers to, making us feel so comfortable with our stay. Stacy even came out of the office area at check in, to greet my wife and I to make sure we had everything we needed. As we reached our room Shelton was right there with our bags and had many very helpful suggestion to make our stay more safe and fun. The next Morning Shelton was down at valet area to help with rental car and he had some maps and other literature that helped us with our drive around the island that first day. The Valet service for our rental car was wonderful. We never had to worry about parking or getting the car when we were ready to leave. I do not remember the name of the gentleman who was so helpful [short, I wish I had remembered his name] All of the valet people were great. I have stayed in Bali at the Hyatt Regency, the Paris Hyatt Regency, the Amsterdam Hyatt and now at the Waikiki Hyatt Regency. I would not stay anywhere else. My membership in the Hyatt club has been the best thing about travel our last 15 year. My compliments to all at Waikiki. I wish I could thank them all again personally. My Best

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Sleep was good until I got up to make me coffee. I noticed that coffee maker had ants inside so I had to clean it myself. But overall room was clean and it felt like home. But price was a little to high.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: From valet to front desk to room service and food was excellent. Even the guy that paled music at the elevators was nice. The pool staff was great and the towel staff was on it. I would definitely stay again and they upgraded us to ocean view.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: My family & I had a great experience! The room and view was perfect. We ate at The Buffet and the food was delicious. There are lots of other places to eat near by. International Market Place, a shopping mall, is just a 5 minute walk away.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Hyatt is very modern compared to the other hotels in waikiki. The staff was super friendly and the hotel room was comfortable and gorgeous. The location is perfect as it is a walking distance to everything else. Overall my husband and I loved our time here and would definitely come back

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Wonderful hotel, service and amenities The staff was always helpful and gave suggestions during our stay. The room was very comfortable and we liked the security feature of using a key card in the elevator

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: From the moment we pulled into the hotel until we checked out we were always greeted by the staff. Not only would they ask how our day was but if they could help us with anything. I loved the reusable water bottles in the room. Each floor has ice machines with a water station. The rooms are quite large for a hotel room. The location is convenient being right across from Waikiki Beach. We dinned at the night buffet with crab legs and prime rib which was about $60 or so per person. Worth it since you are in Waikiki and everything is more on the pricey side. I can't wait to return.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: I chose this place on a whim. Became a member before booking and smooth sailing from there. My husband and I chose the club access. It's amazing. From checking in, checking out, the room service, the location, the food, the drinks... Get that Moana Nui. I loved everything the HYATT had to offer. Memories included.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Hotel is getting old and needs updating, but it is always a pleasure staying there. Great location and ocean view rooms. Great staff! Breakfast buffet has always been great. Many of the shops in the hotel atrium have closed and are vacant.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: We used our member rewards points to stay here and we had no problems redeeming or any extra fees with our stay. Location is perfect right on Waikiki Beach and tons of shopping and restaurants are well within walking distance. Overnight parking is pricey with a rental car so we just found another place to overnight our car for the week. Only complaint is upon check in our room was right behind elevator so it was loud so we asked to move which they accommodated. Second room was much nicer. Had a city view which wasn’t too bad still could see the mountains. And we had our 9 month old which they also provided a mini crib for which worked perfectly. One of the days housekeeping missed our room so we had to call down for clean towels but they were brought up right away and rest of the stay we had no other issues. Overall great hotel, friendly staff, and perfect location.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Very pricey. But excellent location! Breakfast is amazing! Staff were fantastic! Absolutely will be back, was even upgraded to a full ocean view! Only thing I would say was bad would be the wait times for the lifts!

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: The Hyatt continues to bring great value to their guests. This short stay at the Hyatt regency accross the road from Waikiki Beach was magical. Super location, very friendly staff in all aspects ans very accomodating room. Thanks Hyatt for another great experience.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: We stayed in Aloha Tower on 21st floor and were afforded beautiful views of nighttime Honolulu on our wrap-around balcony. Rooms are clean, staff is friendly and helpful, breakfast buffet is a wonderful way to start the day and the nightly reception by the pool really kicks off the evening's fun. Several nights a week guests get to party entertained by a rocking local cover band with island flavor. Kaela is always on hand to ensure a good time is had by all guests. The hotel is close to the beach and all the downtown restaurants, shops and excitement. Great for families as well as couples. We highly recommend this wonderful hotel in the heart of Waikiki.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: The Hyatt on Waikiki was exceptional. Very clean, staff were pleasant, nice added touch with fresh flowers scattered in the room. The location was perfect, everything I needed was only a few steps away.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Exceptional customer service and very accommodating.. I truly felt that everyone was pleasant and very helpful. Hotel is in a terrific location in Waikiki beach. I loved that we were given beach chairs and towels and we just walked across the street to the beautiful ocean.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: excellent staff and facility/ renovations occur without guest impairment/ food quality is excellent/ great location with scenic views/ staff at the tours desk were helpful/ the attentive,caring and pleasant staff throughout the hotel make staying here a delight

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: This was my second trip where I stayed at the Hyatt Regency Waikiki during a business trip to Honolulu. The location is great for evening activities and beach time. The Regency Club staff is top notch and always very friendly. Valet staff was efficient and friendly as well. Elevators can be a bit slow as they do construction but they seem to go out of the way to make the wait tolerable with a little music and by opening up staff elevators for guest use. Ocean views are fantastic. AC didn't cool as much as preferred but had a good, comfortable sleep.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: My wife and I booked this resort for our recent trip to Hawaii and we were not disappointed. Everything was clean and we loved the size of our room. People complain about the wait time for the elevator but we never really waited more than a few minutes ever. It is really just steps from the beach. If there are any negatives it would be that the pool is small for so many guests but we never even found that it was too crowded anytime we went. We were given a room on the 12th floor right next to the elevator but we never were bothered by any noise. We did check other hotel in the area when we were there and the elevators all seemed to be working much more efficiently this is more a design issue of this building. There are only 4 elevators per tower.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: We stayed one night. The check-in and other customer service was fantastic - employees were friendly. The room was clean, comfortable and had a great view of the ocean. We did splurge on the dinner buffet, which had a great selection and was tasty. Would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Good place to stay on Waikiki. Directly across street to beach and Duke's statue, towels provided at valet stand, couple of blocks from marketplace, Dukes restaurant, waterfront shops. Suggest high floor (we were on 30th floor) to avoid street noise (Waikiki is a noisy place). Only complaint is slow elevator service mentioned by others (and true.) Good coffee shop downstairs, enjoyed the pool bar for lunch and drinks (and friendly servers), very good valet services.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: My husband and spent three nights after a cruise to Hawaii. We had a transfer from the cruise ship to the Hotel and this is where my disapointment in choosing this hotel as part of our cruise vacation package started.We were dropped off on a side street where a passenger had to help unload luggage it was chaotic and unorganized. The driver was not sure where we were to go, a person from the hotel showed us where to put our bags and informed me not to leave anything of value on the loading dock. And said just walk around the building with very little direction. The signage was aweful and took a while for the group of us to find the front desk. We were told to come back for 130 as they would put a rush on the room, we came back at 2 and told that rooms are not ready until 3, we came back at 320 and still the room was not ready but they phoned and cancelled what they called a second check of the room and let us in. The hotel was under construction which we did not know would be occurring. The elevators were slow to the point that they posted signage to show peak times.The rooms were large which was nice, the bathroom was worn with the tub paint job very obvious. It looked like they did an upgrade of the room trying to modernize but not done with dedication to details. (Ie bottom of doors all chipped, two tone badly painted tub). The signage throughout was not very clear or visable.The location is right in the middle of things so that is a positive if you want quick access to the beach and shopping. For the price I was very disappointed and I should have explored the hotel better. I know all of the area is expensive $350+ a night hotels, $60 hotel buffet etc.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Hyatt Regency Waikiki staff are always welcoming and friendly. The hotel overall is customer-focused. Their spa services and products are superb.I highly recommend you to check them out by checking into the Hyatt Regency Waikiki very soon for your next stay experience!

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Great Location in central Waikiki, rooms clean and spacious. King Ocean view room - amazing view of the beach, couldn’t quite see Diamond Head but still good.Upgraded to Regency club for 24 hour access to coffee and snacks - this is $60 per day (I thought it was a once off fee).Friendly team, good amenities.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Grace at front desk check in was one of the best we ever encountered and we work for 5 star properties in Vegas. Would go back just to see her!! Besides the construction in lobby that always seems to be there property is beautiful!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: I stay at the Hyatt a lot - this property should not be a Hyatt Regency but more of the middle of the road lodging. There was nothing special about this property. For the money I would stay one block of the strip for half the price. Pool was very small.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: I was extremely happy with the hotel, service, food & lounge. The staff was very attentive & friendly. As a Globalist member I felt very welcomed & Hyatt went beyond my expectations on making sure our stay was exceptional.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: We stayed 2 nights before boarding our cruise. Great location. The staff was excellent . Convenience to other areas of Honolulu was great. Excellent restaurants in the area within walking distance. We really enjoyed our stay.
user_name:
Paul B
Powder Springs, Georgia, United States

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: This hotel is not good if you are in a wheelchair. Everyone was very friendly and helpful when possible. The view was great but beware. You get charged at time of booking an additional $48,00 per day for amenities. That means you get to take home the robes and slippers in your room. But if you stay more than one day you get charged the same price and you only leave with one robe and slippers.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: My husband and I stayed two nights before boarding our cruise. Although the renovation scaffolding is a bit of an eyesore, it didn’t impact our stay. Everyone was super friendly and helpful. Lovely big room. We stayed in the diamond tower on the 5th floor, room 558 (we think) which was classed as a city view but we had a great view of the beach (and the flat rooftops of the lower floors). A great spot for watching the sun rise from our bed. From our balcony we also saw our cruise ship arrive on the Saturday morning which was a surprise and got us super excited for the next leg of our trip. On the Saturday morning there was a parade which we could clearly see from our balcony. Suggest you check exactly what view you’ll get before booking as the rooms are all at different angles and if you want to see the beach, I wouldn’t go lower than floor 5 because the palm trees will obscure your view. We had breakfast included, which saved us a small fortune but there are plenty of places to eat around the ‘strip’. The breakfast buffet catered for all with a healthy choice of foods and fresh juices. Good coffee too. Bed was huge, bath tub and shower were of high quality and the complimentary tote bag and water bottles were a nice touch. We would stay here again. The hotel has plenty of shops in the mall underneath and the central location was great for walking along the beach. We walked to the Aquarium, a long walk but we needed to walk off the breakfast!

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: I traveled with husband, daughter and boyfriend and my sister to wonderful Hawaii for a ‘relaxing’ six night holiday.Can’t fault hotel great breakfast staff etc. we all paid for ocean view rooms (3) but my husband and I had an angled view of beach in a smaller room than the others (12th floor)and mostly looked down the Main Street at Moana Surfrider. Disturbingly a busker in a wheelchair was present every day on street corner below us and was playing very loud music through an amp and often started at 7.30am. I did mention this to front desk and they apologised but I realise not their fault. This meant our day began early, whether we wanted it to or not.It’s our third stay at the Hyatt Regency in Waikiki. We love the location and hotel but might think twice before booking there again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Great place to wind down....our room was very spacious, neat, clean and tidy...coffee/tea making stuff....mini fridge....our room was over looking Waikiki beach, which was great...the location was good to the Waikiki strip...checking was rather slow.... the rest all good

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Absolutely amazing hotel, was so much bigger than I thought. Really couldn't have got a better positioned hotel. Lots to see and do, amazing staff, perfect holiday. We walked from the hotel to diamond head, doable, but hot.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: Stayed here for our 25th wedding anniversary. Our stay started out wonderfully being able to skip the check in lines as Discoverists in Hyatt’s World of Hyatt program. We were welcomed with leis at the front desk and personally by a manager (who checked up on us during our stay). Our room had a orchid heart and chocolates in celebration of our anniversary. The room was huge and very comfortable. We had selected an ocean front king room and had a great view of Waikiki beach. The location was fantastic with all of Waikiki’s restaurants and shops just outside the hotel. The pool was small but didn’t seem crowded. Yes, there was construction going on at the hotel but it didn’t seem to add any noise or inconvenience, other than very slow elevator service. During peak time waits at the elevators, which could be up to 15 minutes (we never experienced waits this long), they had a staff member entertaining with a ukulele.The breakfast buffet was included with our rate and it was one of the best hotel breakfast buffets we’ve ever had. The hotel also has a dinner buffet but, at $65, we didn’t try it.Will definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: To high price for an very old Hotel. Maintenance work ongoing without pre information in advanced to the trip. Very good location. Super front desk service. To small pool. Nice view in all directions.

hotel_name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa
review_body: If you want to stay in an ocean view suite in order to enjoy the sunsets in Waikiki, this is the hotel for you. Staying on the floors 30-40 will give you exquisite views every day. The location is central for walking around the main spots of Waikiki. While the beach is across the street, it is easy to grab towels and chairs from the pool area and bring them to the beach with you. The hotel also has many shops and casual eateries within the first floor mall. There are several ABC stores within the buildings as well, allowing easy access for all of your room and beach needs.We stayed in the Family Suite for the first part of the trip and got upgraded to the Penthouse Suite for the last half of the trip. There are at least 2 more suite styles above the size/quality of the Penthouse Suite. The family suite combines two rooms, one a king suite with full bathtub/shower combo, private lanai, and a living area, the second is a wheelchair accessible studio with a Murphy bed, full bathroom with shower, private lanai, and a seating area. This worked well for us during the week as my partner and I were on different sleeping schedules and he would move to the studio to do work while I was sleeping. It also allowed us to have separate bathroom spaces. The Penthouse Suite is significantly larger, has a separate king bedroom, a full bathroom with shower (I was disappointed in the lack of a bathtub), a walk-in closet, 3 private lanais, one with chaise lounge chairs, a full sized kitchen with a nice refrigerator, a massive living room with lots of couches and chairs, a separate desk space with an Apple computer and printer, and a half bathroom.While the rooms were spacious and appear to have been somewhat recently renovated, there were some downsides. I did not find the quality of the linens, towels, beds, and furniture to be as luxurious or comfortable as other Hyatt Regencys I have stayed at. Part of this may be due to the beach atmosphere and using fabrics that are less likely to stain or be impacted by water and sand. I also found the rooms to be a bit dingy looking as sometimes the paint job was off (mismatched colors), you could see painted over wallpaper seams that were starting to pull apart, and some of the furniture and linens were mildly stained. The set up in the Penthouse suite was a bit frustrating as given the amount of space they had, I'm not sure they used it wisely. Customer service is top notch and overall the value of the rooms could not be beat.
